events.title: Spring Art Showcase
events.description: Join us for our annual Spring Art Showcase featuring works from over 30 local artists. This exhibition celebrates the renewal and growth of spring through diverse artistic mediums including paintings, sculptures, photography, and mixed media installations.
events.additionalInfo: Light refreshments will be served during the opening reception. Free parking available in the adjacent lot.

events.title: Pottery Workshop for Beginners
events.description: Learn the basics of pottery in this hands-on workshop perfect for beginners. You'll create your own bowl and mug while learning fundamental techniques like centering, pulling, and shaping clay on the potter's wheel.
events.requirements: No experience necessary. All materials provided. Please wear clothes you don't mind getting dirty.

events.title: Gallery Opening: Urban Landscapes
events.description: Celebrate the opening of photographer Elena Rodriguez's new exhibition "Urban Landscapes" - a stunning collection of street photography capturing the soul of our city through intimate portraits and architectural studies.

events.title: Digital Art Techniques Workshop
events.description: Dive into the world of digital art with professional artist David Kim. Learn advanced techniques in digital painting, character design, and concept art using industry-standard software and tools.
events.requirements: Basic computer skills required. Tablets and software will be provided, but you're welcome to bring your own device.

events.title: Summer Art Fair
events.description: Our biggest event of the year! Over 100 local artists will display and sell their work in this outdoor fair. Features live music, food trucks, children's art activities, and demonstrations throughout both days.

events.title: Artist Studio Tour
events.description: Go behind the scenes and visit the working studios of 12 local artists. See works in progress, learn about artistic processes, and meet the creators in their creative spaces. Self-guided tour with provided map.

events.title: Jewelry Making Intensive
events.description: A comprehensive two-day workshop covering jewelry making fundamentals. Learn wire wrapping, basic soldering, stone setting, and finishing techniques with master jeweler Carlos Mendoza.
events.requirements: No prior experience needed. Safety equipment and basic materials provided. Lunch included both days.

events.title: Community Art Walk
events.description: Explore the vibrant local art scene with our guided community art walk. Visit 8 galleries, meet artists in their studios, and discover public art installations throughout the historic downtown district.
events.additionalInfo: Free refreshments at participating venues. Map and guidebook provided. Family-friendly event.

events.title: Mixed Media Collage Workshop
events.description: Explore the world of mixed media art with artist James Wilson. Learn layering techniques, texture creation, and how to incorporate found objects into compelling artistic compositions.
events.requirements: All skill levels welcome. Basic materials provided. Bring any personal items you'd like to incorporate into your artwork.
